documents.title: coventry speed cameras to remain turned off
text: it 's been confirmed coventry city council has no plans to switch on the city 's speed cameras , despite eight being upgraded elsewhere in the west midlands police area .
new digital average speed cameras will be operating in birmingham and solihull from july .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: west midlands bucks the trend of drop in sports activity since london 2012
text: the west midlands has bucked the national trend of falling numbers of people playing sport since the 2012 london olym after the games ' pledge to `` inspire a generation '' .
latest figures show 15.8 million people play sport or exercise at least once week , a drop of 0.4 % since 2012 across england .
the west midlands saw a rise from 1,540,100 to 1,590,200 over that time .
analysis of the data found five of the nine regions in england recorded a decline in sports participation , which former sports minister richard caborn dubbed `` disappointing '' .
author: David Rhodes
BBC Yorkshire

documents.title: teen who killed kenilworth man james cooper re-sentenced to two life terms
text: the teenager who killed james cooper and his friend james kouzaris will spend his life behind bars after having his appeal overturned .

documents.title: to lose speedway and stock car racing would be a massive shame , says rugby mp
text: to lose speedway and stock car racing at coventry stadium would be a massive shame .

those are the words of rugby mp mark pawsey , who spoke exclusively to the observer amid fears that the world famous coventry bees could be homeless next season , unless a new lease to extend speedway racing is agreed in the coming weeks .
author: Coventry Observer

documents.title: crews winch pony to safety
text: a pony that fell into the canal at offchurch yesterday needed a little help getting out .
the rider of soda , a piebald mare , was able to scramble out of the water after they both fell into the canal .
but fire crews say they had to use a winch and a tractor to get the animal back to dry land .

documents.title: call for airfield rule change after rugby man dies in microlight crash
text: a coroner has asked for airfield rules to be tightened after two men , including one from rugby , died in an microlight crash .
keith poulton , from flecknoe , near rugby , and retired gp eddie morris , from whitney , died when their aircraft ran off a runway at enstone airfield , near chipping norton , on 3 july last year .
an inquest in oxford heard how the microlight crashed into a trailer full of sheet metal parked nearby .
coroner darren salter said there should be clearer guidance on keeping such areas clear of obstructions .

documents.title: women 's tour : lizzie armitstead leads the pack
text: after the efforts of that queen of mountains , world champion lizzie armitstead is leading the peloton up edge hill , which is about 300m long .
there 's a sharp descent before riders head towards the second sprint of the day .
​ @ twitterid # peloton push hard up burton dasset @ twitterid - a 1.9km climb # avivawt2016 @ twitterid # qom

text: the first ascent at burton dassett is about to start .
it 's 1.9km long and very steep and twisty .

documents.title: women 's tour : two qom climbs in warwickshire stage
text: the warwickshire stage has a good deal of climbing with two designated queen of the mountains climbs with includes more than 1,700 metres of ascent .

the first of those will be at burton dassett hills , while the second comes after the village of ilmington with the ascent of nebsworth hill on the edge of the cotswolds , with a 2.5km climb averaging 5 % .
first of those qom 's today is at burton dassett after 72km and here 's a closer look at that climb
was tough climbing it y'day !

documents.title: women 's tour : first stage winner
text: christine majerus starts in the lead today after sprinting to victory on the opening stage of the women 's tour from southwold to norwich .
the 29-year-old , an eight-time national champion in luxembourg , edged out three-time world road race champion marianne vos on the 138.5km stage .
lizzie armitstead , one of majerus ' boels dolmans team-mates , was the highest-placed briton , finishing 18th .
stage 1 winner @ twitterid christine majerus impressed by the crowds in norfolk/suffolk today .

documents.title: watch : latest weather for coventry and warwickshire
text: any early morning mist will clear , leaving another day of sunny spells and heavy , locally thundery showers .
the showers will be slow moving and some localised surface water flooding is possible again , with highs of 19c ( 66f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: cycling : route of today 's tour
text: warwickshire is hosting the aviva women 's tour for the first time ever , as the peloton visits the county for the second stage of the race .
starting in atherstone , the riders will head south , passing a number of local landmarks including meriden , home to the national cycling memorial , and castles in kenilworth and warwick .
the stage will pass through gaydon and shipston-on-stour , skirting the cotswolds before the finish in stratford-upon-avon .

documents.title: travel : m6 toll accident
text: an accident has closed one lane of the m6 toll southbound between jt3 , sutton colefield , and jt2 , coleshill .
more details on bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning from coventry and warwickshire live
text: welcome to our live service for thursday .
we 'll bring you all the latest news , sport , travel and weather updates throughout the day .
you can get in touch with us via email or tweet us @ bbccovwarks
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live
